Articles.Content: Quick question. Any update on the way the APAS-69 ports dock when on autopilot?

I'd rather he didn't simply leave them be - it's very annoying to have to wait several minutes to fold and unfold the panels each time one switches craft.

The latter option might be a reasonable compromise, assuming folks don't mind having to rebuild their existing stations.

Yeah, I incorrectly assumed CBBP would've known about Snjo and his Firespitter mod, since quite a few other prolific mod makers like B9 already use it.

Anyway, Snjo has also written a specific document on the FSanimateGeneric part module, which supports multiple animations per part. You'll need to contact Snjo to if id they work with the Solar panel's suncatcher system:

CBBP, if I have some time off working on my FusTek Station Parts Expansion this weekend, I might experiment with the Firespitter DLL myself to see if I could retrofit the multiple persistent animation feature into the existing Balka(s). I'll pass on anything usable back to you.

It works, it really does. But after using the "layer", "moduleID", and "name" codes. . . the panels won't rotate and face the sun, neither will it pivot along the central block. So I know SOMETHING's wrong. . . but at least the coding works. If you guys would like to refine it further, go ahead. At least we can help CBBP a bit and everyone else who appreciate this mod and every part with it.

P.S. I can't finish the editing of the code 'cause besides opening and changing a few values. . . I know nothing else.
Is the thread dead?
Nope, just dormant, we would hear a " I'm not continuing KSP modding" or something from cBBp if the thread was dead
A lot of Modders are waiting for 0.21 to drop to see what changes they might need to make to their packs to keep it updated.
yeah, but its odd that such concern would be needed, that is if its just the angara rocket parts he's updating.

Still Alive and kicking just not as fast. Kicks have been getting donated to hour long trips on the elliptical as of late and hiking in new mexico . https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10200946593601406&l=b68d17f615 https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10200946594561430&l=e338fc795d

in other news I updated one of the old engines a bit and redid some of the common engine parts such as turbines and such to have better polies and UV maps. it will make it easier to replace old components on other engines by simple copy and paste in the new and removing the old Auto UV wrapped components. I also have a nice structure for the Gimbal point. Support trusses heading to a ball joint. I think it looks nice. what do you think?

Me and Normak are not sure if we should simplify the turbo pumps. For example that LK-862 engine is very complex. it would be possible to make the pumps simple and stock like as i did with this F-1B engine and RS-86 engines below. Not their simplified stock like appearance. What do you all think? coomplex or simplified?

Edited July 19, 2013 by CardBoardBoxProcessor
Complex. And please, keep the "Angara white" of the old pack.
no one else has input eh?
My vote would be for complex. That new engine looks awesome. I also liked your hiking photos
I like the simple or stock-like ones, (I assume you mean the ones with the sort of tube going into the nozzle/cone.) its easier to see how it would work.

My vote would be for complex. That new engine looks awesome. I also liked your hiking photos

Roger that. And it is not new. just not seen for a while. it is the old LK pack engine.it is getting updated and thanks. a few people relaly like them. i might have to psot all of them somewhere

I like the simple or stock-like ones, (I assume you mean the ones with the sort of tube going into the nozzle/cone.) its easier to see how it would work.

well if you want to see how things work the complex will tell you almost exactly how they work. i could even color code them lol
idk, I'm not sure that's necessary, I don't really care that much about the shape of the engine, I just want rockets that aesthetically fit with kosmos pack.
Welp the RD-862 (Lk's main engine) is in game. first time I put an engine or anything into the game in months. that jeb testing the engine on his personal lander.
Looking great

Nice turbo pumps and hydraulic system (?)

I hope the RD engines will be print like this
Looking really good sir CB. Can't wait to see further development.
That looks excellent, I'd prefer if you kept the old angara white look so it doesn't look like the stock parts and the complex model

So the engine stexture is coming along nicely. i must say it is really turning out awesome and not as much as a PITA as i thought it would be. i think i need to add more colors to my pallet though. It is to shiney all around. It needs more matte colors and such. Pictures in the next few days hopefully.
We're sitting around like Kerbal Meerkats in anticipation

haha sweet thanks.

I'm just wondering just how long it will take this mod, and others to update for 0.21. The new internal reaction wheels in the command pods might take some tweaking for the mod makers to apply to their pods.
renaming the engine to the RD-210 after a similar engine. and since it is not as small as it used to be.. yeah...
this is beautiful
